title: bianca_(dq5)
body:
Bianca is a character from [[Dragon Quest V]]. She first befriends the [[Hero (dq5)|]] when they are both children, and the two share an adventure.  Later in the game, after both have come of age, the hero has the option to marry her. She has a pet Sabrecat named [[Borongo]].

She has [[blonde hair]] that is styled with a [[braid]] [[hair over shoulder|over her right shoulder]] as an adult; as a child, she has it done in braided [[short twintails]].  

h4. External links

* "Dragon Quest Wiki: Bianca":http://dragon-quest.org/wiki/Bianca

title: dragon_quest_monsters:_terry's_wonderland
body:
The first game in the Dragon Quest Monsters spin-off series.  The protagonist is [[Terry (dq6)|]], much younger than in his appearance in [[Dragon Quest VI]], trying to save his sister [[Mireyu]].

The game was originally released on GameBoy Color, localized as Dragon Warrior Monsters, and later received remakes for the PlayStation and Nintendo 3DS.  Neither remake made it overseas.

title: drango
body: The final available main party member of [[Dragon Quest VI]].  A female BattleRex (localized as Hacksaurus) [[Terry (dq6)|]] defeats for the Sword of Thunder near the middle of the game.  She later returns to life and can be recruited by bringing Terry to her cell.  The English translation of the DS remake names her Lizzie.

title: mireyu
body: One of the two female player characters in [[Dragon Quest VI]] (the other one is [[Barbara (dq6)|]]). [[Terry (dq6)|]]'s sister. She also appears in [[Dragon Quest Monsters]], where her name was Milayou in the English version. It is actually supposed to be Mireille. Her name was again retranslated to Milly in the DS version of Dragon Quest VI.

title: terry_(dq6)
body: [[Mireyu]]'s younger brother, a later game party member in [[Dragon Quest VI]].  He later became the protagonist of the first [[Dragon Quest Monsters]] spin off title, [[Dragon Quest Monsters: Terry's Wonderland]].

title: tania_(dq6)
body: Female non-player character in [[Dragon Quest VI]]. The [[hero_(dq6)|Hero]]'s younger sister.

title: barbara_(dq6)
body: One of the two female player characters in [[Dragon Quest VI]]. The other one is [[Mireyu]]. Renamed to Ashlynn in the official NA translation.

title: deborah_(dq5)
body:
Deborah is a character from [i][[Dragon Quest V]][/i], created exclusively for the [[Nintendo DS]] remake of that game.  She is the vain and spoiled older sister of [[Flora (dq5)|]], and when her father offers Flora's hand in marriage to the hero, she insists on being given the chance to marry him as well.

h4.  External links

* "Dragon Quest Wiki: Deborah":http://dragon-quest.org/wiki/Deborah

title: hero's_daughter_(dq5)
body:
[b]JP:[/b] [b]Annie[/b] (SNES), [b]Tabitha[/b] (DS), [b]Poppy[/b] (novelization), [b]Sora[/b] (manga)
[b]EN:[/b] [b]Madchen[/b] (all)

The daughter of the [[hero (dq5)|Hero]] of [i][[Dragon Quest V]][/i]. Has an [[hero's son (dq5)|older brother]].

Like her brother, her hair color varies depending on who her mother is; it will be [[blonde hair|blonde]] with [[green ribbon]]s for [[bianca (dq5)|Bianca]], [[blue hair|blue]] with [[yellow ribbon]]s for [[flora (dq5)|Flora]], and [[brown hair|brown]]/[[black hair|black]] with [[red ribbon]]s for [[Deborah (dq5)|]].

title: soul_of_cinder
body:
[i]"Since Lord Gwyn, the first Lord of Cinder, many exalted lords have linked the First Flame, and it is their very souls that have manifested themselves as defender of the flame."[/i] - Soul of the Lords.

A character from [[Dark Souls III]]. Also known as the Red Knight, and in the Japanese version as the Incarnation of Kings.

[spoiler]The final boss of the main story, the Soul of Cinder is the deific and physical manifestation of the souls of everyone who has ever linked the fire, an amalgamation of their skills and abilities.[/spoiler]

title: dragoon_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[demonic_lancer|Demonic Lancer]]. Also known as the Leviathan or Deimos.

His "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/5/50/Dragonian_Lancer_Art.png] has longer hair, tied into a thin ponytail. He wears a white and navy coat and retains his gray armor from his base class.

As a "Deimos":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/b/be/GenociderPortrait.png], his outfit has been recolored entirely black, with his hair being slightly longer and sporting a thicker ponytail.

title: vanguard_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[demonic_lancer|Demonic Lancer]]. Also known as the Revenant or Warlord.

His "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/5/57/Vanguard_Fullbody.png] features blue Eastern-themed robes with brown accents, and his hair is now shoulder-length. He's also seen wearing gray pauldrons, gauntlets and greaves.

As a "Warlord":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/e/e5/WarlordPortrait.png], his hair is short and swept back, and he wears a black coat with red accents, left unbuttoned at the top revealing an X-shaped scar across his chest. His armor is also now black and gold.

title: elven_knight_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[knight_(dungeon_and_fighter)|Knight]]. Also known as the 1A or 2A.

Her "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/a/a3/Elven_Knight_Full_Body.png] has long, waist-length blonde hair (with some locks styled into curls) and dark green eyes. While her top is fairly similar to her base class, she now wears red thighhighs and gloves along with bronze gauntlets and greaves. Lastly, she wears a white flower in her hair.

As a "Gaia":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/8/80/Gaia.png], her hair is now straight and she wears a frilled white leotard with green accents, green thighhighs, and gray gauntlets and greaves.

title: kamaniki
body: Artist. Streams as vtuber, [[Gigi (kamaniki)]].

title: shadow_dancer_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[rogue_(dungeon_and_fighter)|Rogue]]. Also known as the Nightmare or Grim Reaper.

Her "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/d/d0/ShadowDancer.png] features waist-length hair, a leather jacket and thighhigh boots, a black hooded cape with red ropes and a rose motif on the hood, and a black bodysuit slightly torn in various places.

As a "Grim Reaper":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/2/27/GrimReaper_Fullbody.png], her outfit is mostly the same, save for an extremely long black cape. Her skin has taken on a pale purple tone and her eyes are shadowed underneath.

title: kunoichi_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[rogue_(dungeon_and_fighter)|Rogue]]. Also known as the Izunabi or Shiranui.

Her "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/8/83/KunoichiPortrait.jpg] has her hair styled up into a bun and half-updo. She wears a black leotard and transparent black bodysuit torn in various places, and a pair of black slippers.

As a "Shiranui":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/f/f9/Shiranui_Fullbody.jpg], she wears her hair loose and her skin takes on a light purple tone. She's seen in white robes resembling a short-skirt [[kimono]], white thighhighs, white belts strapped on her thighs holding kunai, red greaves and gauntlets, and a red scarf with orange tips.

title: necromancer_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[rogue_(dungeon_and_fighter)|Rogue]]. Also known as the Defiler or Thanatos.

Her "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/e/e0/NecromancerPortrait.png] has her skin taking on a light purple tone, longer straight hair, a mostly leather black bodysuit with multiple belts on her torso, and black gauntlets and greaves with gold accents. Her main summon, a warrior ghost named Vallacre, is seen hovering behind her.

As a "Thanatos":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/9/95/Thanatos_Fullbody.png], her long hair is styled into curls and she's seen wearing a purple and white dress vest, purple capelet, black stocking and black thighhigh boots. She's seen sitting atop a now-enlarged Vallacre's palm.

title: rogue_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[rogue_(dungeon_and_fighter)|Rogue]]. Also known as the Silver Moon or Alcyone.

Her "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/6/62/RoguePortrait1.png] has her wearing a black tanktop and black pants with hip cutouts. Her white hair is longer and styled into a ponytail.

As an "Alcyone":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/e/e0/Alcyone1.png], she wears a white jacket, black stockings and white boots and sports a rose tattoo on her left cheek. Oddly, her skin is a light purple, a trait that's somewhat common with her fellow Dark Elves.

title: thief_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character.

Her "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/b/bd/ThiefPortrait.png] is a young dark-skinned woman with short, white hair, wearing a black jacket and pants, purple dress vest, and a hat with a blue rose attached to it.

Subclasses:
* [[rogue_(dungeon_and_fighter)|Rogue]] (Silver Moon, Alcyone)
* [[necromancer_(dungeon_and_fighter)|Necromancer]] (Defiler, Thanatos)
* [[kunoichi_(dungeon_and_fighter)|Kunoichi]] (Izunabi, Shiranui)
* [[shadow_dancer_(dungeon_and_fighter)|Shadow Dancer]] (Nightmare, Grim Reaper)

title: mistress_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[female_priest_(dungeon_and_fighter)|female Priest]]. Also known as the Sin Sayer or Redeemer.

Her "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/b/b5/Mistress_Portrait.jpg] features her in a backless black robe, exposing the cross tattoo covering her back. She also wears red gloves, a black belt adorned with various jewellery, and black stockings.

As a "Redeemer":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/a/a0/Redeemer_Portrait.jpg], she's seen wearing a black halter top, leather belts along her legs, and an oversized white jacket. Two pairs of white-tipped black wings are seen on her back.

She is capable of transforming into a [[demon_girl|demon]] with longer black hair tied into a ponytail, purple skin, and pointy ears, wearing nothing except arm-length gloves, demon-themed thighhighs and black pasties.

In all of her official appearances, she's seen wielding a scythe, her weapon of choice.

title: spikemuth
body: Spikemuth is a small town accessible in [[pokemon_swsh|Pokémon Sword and Shield]]. It is [[Marnie (pokemon)|]]'s hometown and the home base of [[Team Yell]].

title: shaman_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[female_priest_(dungeon_and_fighter)|female Priest]]. Also known as the Oracle or Divineress.

Her "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/c/cb/Shaman_Portrait.jpg] features Eastern-themed white and yellow priestess robes and shoulder-length black hair. Her thighhighs have been replaced with black slippers and yellow ties nearly going up to her knees.

As a "Divineress":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/7/7c/Goddess_Portrait.jpg], part of her hair is tied up into a bun, and her outfit is now predominantly white and red.

title: inquisitor_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[female_priest_(dungeon_and_fighter)|female Priest]]. Also known as the Hellkite or Inferno.

Her "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/4/46/Inquisitor_Portrait.jpg] has her short hair tied into a ponytail and wearing white robes with a red cross emblazoned on the front. She's also seen wearing gauntlets, greaves, and some chain mail armor around her waist.

As an "Inquisitor":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/e/e0/Inferno_Portrait.jpg], her outfit is the same as before, but her hair is longer and she comes equipped with more armor, namely pauldrons and a breastplate.

In all of her appearances, she's seen wielding a two-handed battle axe, her weapon of choice.

title: dimension_walker_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[male_mage_(dungeon_and_fighter)|male Mage]]. Also known as the Divergent or Ascendant.

His "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/2/2e/Dimension_Walker_Portrait.png] has him swap his default jacket for a black and purple robe that looks vaguely like a laboratory smock. He also has a gas mask hanging around his neck (with metal horns in place of filters) and a few syringes strapped to his left leg.

As an "Ascendant":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/8/85/MMage_Ascendant.png], he instead wears a black, hooded cape with purple trim and black shorts. His main summon, [[nyarly_the_forbidden|Forbidden Nyarly]], is floating behind him.

title: swift_master_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[male_mage_(dungeon_and_fighter)|male Mage]]. Also known as the Tempest or Aiolos.

His "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/d/df/Swift_Master_Portrait.png] features waist-length hair tied into several thin braids, wearing similar clothing to his base class with the addition of gold accents. He also wears a white scarf and sash.

As an "Aiolos":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/8/85/Aeolus.png], he trades the purple jacket and vest for a long white coat, foregoing a shirt.

title: blood_mage_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[male_mage_(dungeon_and_fighter)|male Mage]]. Also known as the Bloodseeker or Vampire Lord.

His "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/e/e7/Blood_Mage_Portrait.png] has his hair growing to waist-length and features dark purple Victorian-era clothing with red and gold accents. The bats he commands fly in the background.

As a "Vampire Lord":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/3/3c/Vampire_Lord.png], his appearance remains mostly the same, save for his cape taking on the form of bat-like wings.

title: zygarde
body:
[[Pokemon]] #718 in the National PokéDex, a dual-type Dragon/Ground Legendary Pokémon. 

A legendary [[pokemon_(creature)|Pokémon]] in [[pokemon_xy|Pokémon X and Y]], notable for its green, black, and white hexagonal scales, tentacle arm-like appendages, 5 large scale-like appendages coming from its back, serpentine appearance, and its ability to thwart the special powers and abilities of [[xerneas|Xerneas]] and [[yveltal|Yveltal]]. 

Comes in the following [[alternate_form|Formes]]:

* [[Zygarde (complete)]]
* [[Zygarde (50%)]]
* [[Zygarde (10%)]]
* [[Zygarde Core]]
* [[Zygarde Cell]]

h4. External links

* "Bulbapedia: Complete Forme":http://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/File:718Zygarde-Complete_XY_anime.png

Next Pokémon: [[Diancie]]

title: mato_(mato-san_no_hon)
body:
Manga illustrator from Japan. She was born in the Ehime Prefecture and her birthdate is November 27th. She was the illustrator for the [[pokemon adventures|Pokémon Adventures manga]] until volume nine. She stopped drawing for the series due to an illness which left her hand weak and unable to draw, leading [[Yamamoto Satoshi]] to take over her position from volume ten onward.
Her other works include [i]Nightingale[/i] and [i]New Year X-mas[/i], which was serialized in Shonen Sunday.

Japanese name: 真斗 (Mato)
Circle name: 真斗さんの本 (Mato-san no Hon)
Site name: 真斗さんのホームページ

h4.See also

title: original_zero
body:
The sub-boss of [[The King of Fighters 2001]]. Fights using 3 strikers ([[Krizalid]], [[Ron (kof)|]], and his pet lion [[Glaugan]])

Unlike [[Zero (KOF)|his clone]], this Zero is extremely loyal to the NESTS syndicate and was disgusted to learn of his clone's attempted coup d'état. He was resting in NESTS's main headquarters during the events of 2000 and was unaware of his clone's actions until later.

He was ordered by the leader of NESTS to resume their primary plan of world conquest. Since the fighting data of the world's fighters had already been gathered and saved in the main database of NESTS's computers, the cartel planned to be rid of them and take over the then helpless planet.

Willing to clear his reputation of his clone's actions, True Zero is commanded to destroy the winners of The King of Fighters tournament. He traps the winning team in a space ship that was disguised as a blimp. He then informs the team about their real destination to NESTS's main headquarters in outer space as well as other information concerning NESTS's intentions.

Upon being defeated by the player, he urges the team to escape the collapsing ship and presumably dies honorably on board the vessel. 

He fights in the same way as his clone was, but he loses his clone's shadow arts in exchange for his strikers.

Voiced by Arai Toshimitsu.

title: omega_rugal
body:
An alternate form of [[Rugal Bernstein]] in [[The King of Fighters '95]]. He is basically a cyborg version of Rugal who now becomes stronger thanks to a pact he made with [[Orochi (kof)|]].

He has then since appeared in dream match games, either as a [[palette swap]] or a recolor of the original Rugal.

The original Rugal and Omega Rugal can be differentiated by their backs. Omega Rugal has what seems to be the jet mufflers that the original Rugal lacks while charging the Kaiser Wave, as well as an [[omega symbol]] engraved on the back of his top.

Their movesets also differ in [[The King of Fighters '98|KOF 98]]. Omega Rugal had the Gravity Smash in exchange for Normal Rugal's Reppuken, the Vanishing Rush in exchange for the Kaiser Wave, and the Destruction Omega in exchange for the Dead End Screamer. Omega Rugal also gains a move that was never used by Normal Rugal: the Rugal Execution.

In [[The King of Fighters 2002|KOF 2002]], Omega Rugal used the same moves as Normal Rugal had in [[The King of Fighters '94|KOF 94]] but with the addition of the Beads Destruction, and the altering between Kaiser Wave, Divine Arrow, and Gravity Smash. He gains a new MAX2 in the form of the Kaiser Phoenix, which is a barrage of Kaiser Waves, Divine Arrows, and Gravity Smashes in one move.

title: electric_hearts
body:
"[b]Electric Hearts[/b] is a personal sci-fi project that I have been working on for almost two decades. It features robotic [[furry|anthropomorphic animal]] characters, which I currently call "[[android]]s". The androids in Electric Hearts were originally developed by human. While human themselves had been wiped out after an apocalyptic event, some of their androids survived and they began to rebuild from what was left of the Earth Civilization. The project will follow generations of androids through the darkness of the post-apocalyptic Earth into the starlight of their inter-universal civilization, presenting their people, society and historical events of different time periods."

h5. Names of the project
"Because the development time of this project has been so long, it had been renamed a few times for various reasons. But regardless of the names, they all point to the same thing."

* [b]Electric Hearts[/b] (first and current name)
* inter.Natal (x)
* Oasis (x)
* Xing (x)
* SYNC (x)
* A3 (x)

h5. Current state and plans
DONE: Electric Heart's art style has been developed to the point that I can be satisfied with.
DONE: Many characters have been made, or at least have a sketch of what they roughly are.
DOING: The current task is writing the story (or history), and to decide how the story is told.
TO-DO: In what form the final product is presented has not been decided yet.

\* This article is a work-in-progress. It will be gradually expanded into a fully-fledged information portal.

h4. External links
* "DeviantArt: Electric Hearts":[https://www.deviantart.com/tysontan/journal/Electric-Hearts-695688174]

title: bakumatsu_rouman
body:
[b]Bakumatsu Rouman[/b] (幕末浪漫 月華の剣士, transl. [i]The Last Blade[/i]) is a fighting game series that takes place in Bakumatsu era Japan (AD 1864). A notable [[SNK]] fighter on the NeoGeo, it's known for its fluid gameplay, sharp graphics, Japanese mythology references, varied cast of characters, and for being a product of [[Guilty Gear]]'s creator, [[Ishiwatari Daisuke]].

The character designer of the game is [[Senno Aki]].

title: nasa_logo
body:
The logo of the [[NASA|United States' National Aeronautics and Space Administration]].  Images should depict one of NASA's three official logos, their insignia, logotype, or official seal.

h6.  Red, White, and Blue Insignia - 1959-1975 & 1992-present

Commonly known as the "meatball" logo, it depicts the name NASA written in white along with white stars representing space overlaid on a blue circle representing a planet.  A red v-shaped wing represents aeronautics and a white orbital around the name represents space travel.
Example: post #2959451

h6. NASA logotype 1975-1992 & 2020-present

Commonly known as the "worm" logo, it is a simple logo only depicting the name NASA in a stylized red font.  It was retired in 1992, but was brought back as a secondary NASA logo in celebration of the return of manned spaceflights being launched from US soil.
Example: post #3336963

h6. Official Seal

Sharing most of the same elements as the "meatball" logo the official seal is reserved for formal events.  It depicts a yellow sphere representing a planet with an orbital around it and a red v-shaped wing on it, these are on a blue fading to black background filled with stars and another sphere. The full title National Aeronautics and Space Administration circles the image with USA written on the bottom.

h6. 

"Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NASA_insignia]

title: red_panda
body:
A species of arboreal mammals. Although called pandas, they're closer to raccoons in gait. It's taxonomic name is [i]Ailurus fulgens[/i].

Not to be confused with the [[raccoon]] or the [[tanuki]], despite looking similar to both animals. Red pandas can be recognized by their reddish-brown fur, white facial markings and longer bodies.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Red panda":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_panda]

title: aist-class_lcac
body: The Aist class (NATO-Code; Russian Project 12321 Dzheyran) was the first large assault hovercraft operated by the Soviet Navy. It was designed by the Almaz design bureau wing of the Almaz Shipbuilding Company in 1964–1965. Production of the craft lasted from 1970 until 1985 at Almaz's plant in Leningrad.

title: pt-76
body:
The PT-76 is a Soviet amphibious light tank that was introduced in the early 1950s and soon became the standard reconnaissance tank of the Soviet Army and the other Warsaw Pact armed forces. It was widely exported to other friendly states, like India, Iraq, Syria, North Korea and North Vietnam. Overall, some 25 countries used the PT-76.[citation needed]

The tank's full name is Floating Tank–76 (плавающий танк, plavayushchiy tank, or ПТ-76). 76 stands for the caliber of the main armament: the 76.2 mm D-56T series rifled tank gun.

title: ratoratah_(ooo_combo)
body:
One of [[Kamen Rider OOO]]'s combos, accessed via the Lion, Tiger (Tora), and Cheetah Core Medals.

OOO can emit an infrared light called the Liodias via the Lion Head, which is intense enough to incinerate, and run like the [[wind]] with the Cheetah Legs.

His Scanning Charge is the Gush Cross, which projects three yellow rings in front of OOO before charging through them with the Cheetah Medal's speed before delievering a cross slash on the target with the Tora Claws infused with the Lion Medal's energy projection.

title: kindergarten
body:
Youchien (幼稚園) or Japanese Kindergarten is a form of preschool for children ages 3-6.  There are both public and private kindergartens. They're all supervised by the Japanese Ministry of Education, but are not a part of the official education system.

In addition to kindergarten there are also hoikuen or Japanese Nurseries/Day-cares for children ages 0-6.  These are supervised by the Ministry of Labor. Unlike the kindergartens they're less focused on educational activities.

title: female_spitfire_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[female_gunner_(dungeon_and_fighter)|female Gunner]]. Also known as the Valkyrie or Freyja.

Her "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/9/92/FemaleSpitfirePortrait.png] is the same as her base class with the addition of metal armor on her shoulders and sides of her skirt and a small white and blue beret. She also has a harness with various grenades hanging off of it, and wields a "Crossmore" mine in her left hand, used in one of her skills.

As a "Freyja":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/b/b7/Fem_spit2.png], she has more rugged clothing in the form of a black pair of shorts and tanktop, with the only element in common with her prior forms being a white cloth vest with blue trimmings. She's also seen wearing a miniature jetpack on her back.

title: female_mechanic_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[female_gunner_(dungeon_and_fighter)|female Gunner]]. Also known as the Metalheart or Optimus.

Her "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/7/70/FemaleMechanicPortrait.png] is similar to her base class's with the addition of a white robe that resembles a stylized lab coat. She's seen holding a remote control, presumably to give orders to the robots behind her.

Her appearance as an "Optimus":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/9/95/Optimus.png] is similar to her first Awakening, now wearing an actual lab coat and additionally safety goggles over her eyes. Behind her is the Volt MX, a humanoid mecha used in one of her skills.

title: female_launcher_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[female_gunner_(dungeon_and_fighter)|female Gunner]]. Also known as the Demolitionist or Storm Bringer.

Her "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/7/79/FemaleLauncherPortrait.png] features [[adapted_costume|a more militarized version of her base class's outfit]] with similar coloration, also coming equipped with black metal gauntlets and yellow goggles on her head. She wields a laser cannon, one of her sub-weapon skills in the game.

Her "Storm Bringer":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/9/9c/Storm_Trooper.png] outfit is predominantly black and gold, wearing a backpack unit armed with many of her sub-weapons, such as a gatling gun, laser cannon, and a pair of rocket launchers.

title: female_ranger_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[female_gunner_(dungeon_and_fighter)|female Gunner]]. Also known as the (1st awakening name) or (2nd awakening name).

Her "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/a/ad/FemaleRangerPortrait.png] is a [[adapted_costume|cowboy-themed version of her base class's outfit]] with similar coloration. She also has a small cowboy hat and ammunition belts around her waist and a smaller one around her right leg.

As a "Crimson Rose":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/4/4d/Crimson_Rose.png], she has predominantly black and red clothing, with her revolvers coming equipped with bayonets and chains at the handle to swing them around as melee weapons.

[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Her "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/0/08/FemaleGunnerPortrait.png] features a white Eastern-themed top and black skirt, with her blonde hair being done up in a [[half_updo|half updo]].

title: octopus_boy
body: Male counterpart of [[Scylla]]s.

title: male_brawler_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[male_fighter_(dungeon_and_fighter)|male Fighter]]. Also known as the Rampager or Hades.

His "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/7/73/MaleBrawlerPortrait.png] gives him appropriate clothing for a street brawler - black vest, red shirt, and tattered black jeans. He wields chain whips as a weapon.

As a "Hades":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/4/47/Hades_Fullbody.png], he wears a black dress vest on top of his red shirt and now wields a nail bat with mines covering it. He also has a black eyepatch covering his right eye.

His "Neo Brawler":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/7/7f/Full_Neo-_Male_Brawler_Artwork.png] appearance is generally similar to the Hades, with the exception of a black fur-trimmed coat and slicked-back hair.

title: dark_templar_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[female_slayer_(dungeon_and_fighter)|female Slayer]]. Also known as the Dark Empress or Nemesis.

Her "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/3/34/DarkTemplarPortrait.png] sports her [[hair_over_one_eye|hair over one eye]] and a fancier dress compared to her base class, as well as a gold-trimmed breastplate and demon-themed gauntlets.

As a "Dark Templar":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/d/d1/NemesisWallpaper.jpg], she wears slightly more armor than her first Awakening counterpart, also sporting a black cape. Ironically, she doesn't appear to be [[naked_armor|wearing much else]] aside from that.

As a "Neo Dark Templar":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/3/38/Full_Neo-_Dark_Templar_Artwork.jpg], she wears predominantly black and gold clothing with a hooded cape and a spiked black halo floating behind her.

title: vagabond_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[female_slayer_(dungeon_and_fighter)|female Slayer]]. Also known as the Dualist or Blade Dancer.

Her "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/e/ed/VagabondPortrait1.png] features Eastern-themed clothing, dual-wielding swords with blades that appear to be made of energy.

As a "Blade Dancer":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/5/5d/SwordEmpressWallpaper.jpg], she has red and black robes and longer hair.

Her "Neo Vagabond":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/3/3f/Full_Neo-_Vagabond_Artwork.jpg] form instead has predominantly white clothing with lotus-themed imagery and her hair done up into a ponytail.

title: demon_slayer_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[female_slayer_(dungeon_and_fighter)|female Slayer]]. Also known as the Demonbane or Deicide.

Her "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/8/8a/DemonSlayerPortrait.png] swaps out her black dress for a similar one with a [[cleavage_cutout|cleavage cutout]]. The red-skinned figure behind her is the demon Daimus, one of three demons who possesses the Demon Slayer's [[whip_sword|whip sword]].

As a "Demonbane":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/f/f3/DeicideWallpaper.jpeg], her outfit is completely different, appearing to be bondage gear.

Her "Neo Demon Slayer":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/9/94/Full_Neo-Demon_Slayer_Artwork_Alt.png] outfit has a long black dress with red fur trimmings and red chains trailing its skirt. She also wears a demon-themed headpiece and claw-like gauntlets. Daimus is still in the background, this time taking on a more monstrous appearance.

title: sword_master_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[female_slayer_(dungeon_and_fighter)|female Slayer]]. Also known as the Noblesse or [[majesty_(dungeon_and_fighter)|Majesty]].

Her appearance as a "Sword Master":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/b/b9/Sword_Master.png] is generally the same as her base class, save for a [[bob_cut|bob cut]].

As a "Majesty":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/7/74/MajestyWallpaper.jpg], she instead wears a black dress and white cape, with multiple weapons floating behind her to demonstrate her mastery over swords.

As a "Neo Sword Master":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/2/2c/Full_Neo-_Sword_Master_Artwork.jpg], she wears mostly leather clothing and has traded the white cape for a black one, seemingly made of fur.

title: thanatos_(persona)
body:
Ultimate Persona of the Death arcana in [[Persona 3]].  Summoned momentarily when the protagonist first summons [[Orpheus (persona)|]] in the early game and later can be fused and summoned regularly after completing the Death social link.  

The mystery of Thanatos's sudden appearance is central to the plot, though this is not apparent until much later.  Accordingly, Thanatos along with [[Orpheus (persona)|]] are the two most common of the protagonist's many Personas that appear in artwork involving him/her.

[spoiler]Actually, it is Death itself who emerged in the early game, having been sealed in the protagonist by Aegis many years ago when he was a child. Generally speaking, this tag should be used for either character as they are nigh-identical in appearance, differing only slightly in color scheme.[/spoiler]

title: urd_(aa_megami-sama)
body:
[i]For other characters with the same etymology, see [[Urth]] wiki.[/i]

Urd (ウルド Urudo) is an [[Aa Megami-sama]] character, and [[Belldandy]] and [[Skuld (aa megami-sama)|]]'s half-demoness older sister, as well as [[Marller]]'s old friend. She can be described as sexy, exotic, lazy, and rebellious, but she also displays a deep and mature side of her when she feels that the situation requires it. Loves getting drunk on [[sake]] which also counts as her alternative source of energy while on Earth. Her favorite hobby is alchemy, often spending a lot of time making all sorts of potions, and even fashions herself as a "love goddess" despite her far from ideal methods. 

Even though she's a goddess, Urd shares a lot of personality traits with her mother, [[Hild (aa megami-sama)|]]. She even looks almost like a younger version of her mother, and wears similar clothes that display her [[absolute_cleavage|cleavage]].

Urd shares a close relationship with her sisters, being extremely protective of both of them, although that doesn't stop her from "arguing" with [[Skuld (aa megami-sama)|]]. Still, [[Belldandy]] admits that she feels rather jealous of how close those two are. 

She has a different look in the 2000s as opposed to the 1990s; her [[white hair]] went from [[wavy_hair|wavy]] to straight, her face is thinner, and her eyes go from [[green_eyes|green]] to [[purple eyes|purple]].

Voiced by: "Yumi Toma":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yumi_T%C5%8Dma]

title: skuld_(aa_megami-sama)
body:
Skuld is a character from the [[Aa Megami-sama]] anime and manga. Like her sisters, she's a 10-dimensional entity that is able to manifest and survive in our 4-dimensional universe thanks to her emblem control program (that is located on her forehead).

If she uses too much energy (or if the functioning of her emblem control program is disrupted), she can use ice-cream (preferably the brand 131) as an alternative energy source.

title: peorth_(aa_megami-sama)
body:
A [[Aa Megami-sama]] character and the fourth goddess to arrive at [[Morisato Keiichi]]'s household. She's a wish granter just like [[Belldandy]], although from a rival agency called the "Earth Help Center" and at least according to her, she specializes in carnal wishes. Peorth believes that she's been summoned because Keiichi's wish hadn't been granted by Belldandy, and assuming that it's because the boy wants to have sex, but Belldandy won't give him any, she focuses on seducing him. 

Despite being a goddess, Peorth seems to be rather prideful and even more sensual than [[Urd (aa megami-sama)|]], as she walks around in nothing more than a bikini, and boasts that her "service" is the best in her agency. However, she also seems to hold a grudge against Belldandy due to some past incident, that might explain some of her aggression, as well as why she tried so hard to best her. Once that's cleared (proven to be nothing more than a misunderstanding), Peorth calms down quite considerably, and even helps Belldandy and Keiichi get closer.

Voiced by "Rei Sakuma":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rei_Sakuma]

title: ansuz
body:
[[Aa Megami-Sama]] character.

Ansuz (アンザス Anzasu), is the CEO of the Goddess Collective and the mother of [[Skuld (aa megami-sama)|]] and [[Belldandy]]. She's Tyr's (often referred to as Almighty/Kami-sama in the early series) second wife, after he got separated from [[Hild (aa megami-sama)|]] at some point of time prior the events of the series. Additionally, she acts as [[Urd ((aa megami-sama)|]]'s stepmother, and even treats her just like her own daughters. That being said, Ansuz displays a pretty "hands-off" parenting attitude, most likely due to her duties. As a result, she doesn't seem to be as close to her daughters as they are to each other, which is especially true in Skuld's case who was all but raised by Belldandy. 

Part of Ansuz's duties is to act as the Interspecies Romance Inquisitor, whose job is to test any god or goddess who wishes to get into a relationship with another species (whether demon, or mortal), by sending them through the Judgment Gate. This was also the case with Hild and Tyr (whom Ansuz eventually married after this event, while the only ones shown to pass it, are Belldandy and Keiichi. 

Despite Hild's status as Tyr's ex-wife, Ansuz seems to maintain a good relationship with her. They do enjoy playing games together, and she even expresses her disappointment when Hagall tells her that she needs to leave Hell, before she ends up getting trapped in there. Still, that doesn't stop her and Hild from antagonizing each other, although it should be noted that they're not really all that serious about it.

Ansuz is named after the eponymous "A" rune from the Elder Futhark, and at the time of writing this, she remains a manga-exclusive character.

title: usui_yoshito
body:
A manga artist known for the popular manga [[Crayon Shin-chan]]. He and his wife raised two daughters; both had moved out of the house at the time of Usui's death.

On September 12, 2009, Usui's family reported him missing from his hometown of Kasukabe when Usui did not return from hiking in nearby Gunma Prefecture. On September 19, 2009, a body with clothes matching those described in the report filed by Usui's family was found at the bottom of a cliff at Mount Arafune in Gunma. The body was identified as being that of Usui.

title: kushinada_yuki
body:
Yuki is a character from [[SNK]]'s [[The King of Fighters]]. She made her initial debut in [[The King of Fighters '97]] as a secondary character. She is an ordinary school girl and is the girlfriend of [[Kusanagi Kyou]]. She was kidnapped by [[Nanakase Yashiro]], [[Shermie (kof)|]], and [[chris (kof)|Chris]] prior to the King of Fighters '97, with the intent of using her as a sacrifice for [[Orochi_(kof)|Orochi]]. The only line spoken by Yuki's voice actor in the entire game series was: "Matteru kara ne, Kyou!" ("I'll wait for you, Kyo!"). The first and only time when Yuki fought was in the crossover game, [[snk gals fighters|SNK Gals' Fighters]] where she appeared as a secret character and fought with her [[school bag]]. She, like her boyfriend is not very fond of [[Yagami Iori]].

She is voiced by Kojima Tomoko.

h4. External links

* "SNK Wiki: Yuki":[https://snk.fandom.com/wiki/Yuki_(KoF)]

title: ikezawa_hanako
body:
[[katawa_shoujo|Katawa Shoujo]] character.

Hanako is a student at Yamaku High School. Her dark purple hair hangs down across the right side of her face, hiding significant scarring. She is incredibly shy and has difficulty opening up to anyone except [[satou lilly|Lilly]], who is blind. 

Hanako is one of [[nakai hisao|Hisao's]] classmates, but is frequently absent, preferring to spend time reading in the library.

title: koniggratzer_marsch
body:
[b]Der Königgräzer or Der Königgräzer Marsch[/b] is one the most recognisable songs in German history. The song is about the Battle of Königgrätz which was fought between the Austrian Empire and the Prussian Empire which ended in a Prussian victory.

The song became more well known due to [[Adolf Hitler]] using the song during his rallies before and after coming into power. After [[World War II]] the song was not used for a time until around 1955 when the West German military was reformed.

Der Königgräzer Marsh was originally composed in 1866, [b][u]a long time before it was ever associated with the Nazi’s and their ideology.[/u][/b] The song is still being used today by the German military.
other_names: ケーニヒグレッツ行進曲

title: tajador_(ooo_combo)
body:
One of [[Kamen Rider OOO]]'s final combos, accessed via the Hawk (Taka), Peacock (Kujaku), and Condor Core Medals.

This combo's primary motif is the [[Phoenix]], often called the king of birds and is a mix of different kinds of birds. In this form, the Taka Head becomes the Taka Head Brave with the eyes becoming [[red eyes|red]] rather than the usual [[green eyes|green]], wings protrude from the Taka Head, and the hawk head symbol on the forehead becomes more prominant. OOO can now see far distances, create energy peacock tail feathers to direct at opponents, use the Kujaku Wings to fly, project core medal like energy at it's opponents, shoot streams of [[fire]] and use the talon-like attachments of the Condor Legs called the Raptor Edges.

This form is armed with the Taja Spinner that can fire orbs of energy at its opponent. It can also hold a number of Core Medals, enabling him to perform the Giga Scan attack called the Magna Blaze, generating a phoenix-like aura around him before charging at an opponent and striking them.

His Scanning Charge is the Prominence Drop, where after sprouting wings from the Kujaku Arms, Kamen Rider OOO flies into the air and performs a flying drop kick, with the talons on the Condol Legs splitting apart, on the target.

title: tatoba_(ooo_combo)
body:
[[Kamen Rider OOO]]'s default combo, accessed via the Hawk (Taka), Tiger (Tora), and Hopper (Batta) Core Medals.

The Taka Head allows OOO to see better when enemies are hiding, the Tora Claws allow him to increase his attack range, and the Batta Legs allow him to jump at greater heights.

His Scanning Charge is the TaToBa Kick, where after jumping high up through the Batta Legs, he descends with a drop kick through the three rings that form, which are in the primary colors of the Taka, Tora, and Batta Medals which surround him in auras depending on the Core Medals. After passing through the red ring representing the Taka Medal, he is surrounded in a red veil with wings, the yellow ring representing the Tora Medal gives an aura with claws, while the green ring representing the Batta Medal gives an aura with legs.

title: tsuzurao
body:
Japanese version: ツヅラオ (Tsuzurao)
English version: Rao

A character from the game [[ookami_(game)|Ookami]], Tsuzurao(Rao) is notable for her priestess clothing and hood, [[bead necklace]], her [[black hair]] that [[hair_over_one_eye|covers one eye]], and (her most defining feature) her [[large breasts]].

[spoiler]
The Tsuzurao met by Amaterasu is actually the demon lord [[Ninetails (ookami)|]] in disguise. The real Tsuzurao was killed and her identity stolen in order to trick Amaterasu into retrieving the Fox Rods and to infiltrate Queen [[Himiko (ookami)|]]'s palace). The fake has red beads and [[hair_over_one_eye]], while the original has blue beads.

Judging from her full name in the story, 九十九尾比丘尼 (Tsuzurao-no-Bikuni), she is modeled after the legend of "Yao Bikuni":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ningyo#Yao_Bikuni].
[/spoiler]

body: Character in [[Ookami (game)|]]. A small creature who appears to be nothing more than a tiny bug that gives off a green glow, he is actually a humanoid called a "Poncle", and looks bug-like because of the hat he wears, which is made from a beetle's round shell (with antennae). This perverted little guy acts as your guide, and also your voice when speaking to people, as Amaterasu cannot talk. In fact, while Issun can understand most animals, he cannot understand Ammy outside of her actions and canine expressions.

title: kojima_genta
body: A character from [[Meitantei Conan]]. One of [[Edogawa Conan]]'s classmates, he is a large-statured boy with a voracious appetite, and loves eel rice. He is sometimes slow and dim, but has a lot of enthusiasm for solving cases.

title: hattori_heiji
body: A character from [[Meitantei Conan]]. A Kansai-accented high school detective who lives in Kyoto, and managed to figure out that [[Edogawa Conan]] and [[Kudou Shin'ichi]] are the same person. They become friends and exchange deductions to solve cases. His girlfriend is [[Tooyama Kazuha]], but they argue a lot. A running joke is that he inherited his dark skin tone from his grandfather.

title: hakuba_saguru
body: A character from [[Magic Kaito]] and [[Meitantei Conan]]. A high school detective similar to [[Kudou Shin'ichi]] and [[Hattori Heiji]], but often tends to solve cases in Britain. Used to be [[Kaitou Kid]]'s rival before Shin'ichi arrived. Saguru owns a pet falcon called Watson.

title: matsuda_jinpei
body:

Matsuda has become notorious as [[Meitantei Conan]]'s most famous "one scene wonder":http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OneSceneWonder.

body:
A [[mecha]] from [i][[Shinkansen Henkei Robo Shinkalion]][/i] that turns into an [[E3 Tsubasa]] [[shinkansen]] [[train]]. It is armed with [[kunai]] and [[shuriken]], has an overall [[ninja]] theme, and it's finishing move is the [b]Railway Crossing Shuriken[/b]. Unlike the other Shinkalion units, the E3 [[Naruto run|Naruto runs]] instead of skating when it needs to move quickly.

It is driven by [[Tsukiyama Shinobu]], and is later replaced by the [[E3 Tsubasa Iron Wing]].

title: knights_templar
body:
Templars were among the most famous of the Western Christian military orders. The organization existed for nearly two centuries during the Middle Ages. 

Officially endorsed by the Catholic Church around 1129, the Order became a favored charity throughout Christendom, and grew rapidly in membership and power. Non-combatant members of the Order managed a large economic infrastructure throughout Christendom, innovating financial techniques that were an early form of banking, and building fortifications across Europe and the Holy Land. 

Templar knights, in their distinctive white mantles with a red cross, were among the most skilled fighting units of the Crusades. 

h4. See also

* [[knights hospitaller]] 
* [[teutonic knight]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Knights Templar":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Knights_Templar

title: teutonic_knight
body:
A German medieval military order, and in modern times a purely religious Catholic order. It was formed to aid Christians on their pilgrimages to the Holy Land and to establish hospitals.

Its members have commonly been known as the Teutonic Knights, since they also served as a crusading military order in the Middle Ages. 

Their outfits were mainly white in color and black cross as their emblem.

h4. See also

* [[knights hospitaller]]
* [[knights templar]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Teutonic Order":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Teutonic_Order

title: tpz_fuchs
body:
The TPz (Transportpanzer) Fuchs ("fox") is a German armoured personnel carrier originally developed by Daimler-Benz but manufactured and further developed by the now Rheinmetall MAN Military Vehicles (RMMV). Fuchs was the second wheeled armoured vehicle to enter service with the Bundeswehr (West German Military) and it can be used for tasks including troop transport, engineer transport, bomb disposal, Nuclear, Biological and Chemical reconnaissance and electronic warfare. RMMV and its predecessors manufactured 1,236 Fuchs 1, mostly for the German Army.

Further development of the design resulted in the Fuchs 2, first shown in 2001. The enhanced Fuchs 2 is currently in production, known customers include Algerian Army, Kuwait Army and the United Arab Emirates Army (UAE).


h4. See also
* Wikipedia: "Transportpanzer Fuchs":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TPz_Fuchs

title: pedophile
body:
An adult with a sexual attraction towards prepubescent children. 

This tag is for references to the concept of lolicon or shotacon, or for characters implied to be a lolicon, shotacon, or pedophile. Usually done in humor by artists to poke fun at the lolicon population. Such pictures will typically not depict any actual [[loli]]/[[shota]], or, if they do, it will be done humorously, often either poking fun at otaku lolicons or ending in misfortune for them.

title: adam_(mythology)
body:
An Abrahamic mythological figure, usually linked to the copyright tag [[The Bible]].
The first human [[Yahweh]] (or Allah, etc.) ever made. Made from dust (name derived from the Hebrew word for earth, clay) in God's image. Along with [[eve (mythology)|Eve]], he is the ancestor of all of humanity. 

When not [[nude]], he is commonly depicted clothed in a [[fig leaf]] after eating the fruit.

title: eve_(mythology)
body:
According to the creation story in [[the Bible]] and Qur'an, the mother of all humanity and wife of the [[adam (mythology)|Adam]] the First Man. Created from one of Adam's ribs while he slept.

When not [[nude]], she is commonly depicted clothed in a [[fig leaf]] after eating the fruit.

h4.See also

* "Pixiv tag search for The Adam and Eve myth":http://www.pixiv.net/search.php?word=%E3%82%A2%E3%83%80%E3%83%A0%E3%81%A8%E3%82%A4%E3%83%96%20OR%20%E3%82%A8%E3%83%87%E3%83%B3%E3%81%AE%E5%9C%92%20-%E3%83%80%E3%83%B3%E3%83%9C%E3%83%BC%E3%83%AB%E6%88%A6%E6%A9%9F%20-%E3%83%80%E3%83%B3%E6%88%A6%20-%E2%84%83-ute%20-%E3%82%A2%E3%83%80%E3%83%A0%E3%81%A8%E3%82%A4%E3%83%96%E3%81%AE%E3%82%B8%E3%83%AC%E3%83%B3%E3%83%9E%20-%E3%83%A9%E3%82%A4%E3%82%A2%E3%83%BC%E3%82%B2%E3%83%BC%E3%83%A0%20-LIARGAME%20-%E5%89%B5%E4%BD%9C%3A%E3%82%A8%E3%83%87%E3%83%B3%E3%81%AE%E5%9C%92

title: the_saga_of_darren_shan
body:
The Saga of Darren Shan (known as Cirque Du Freak: The Saga of Darren Shan in the United States) is a young adult 12-part book series written by Darren Shan (pen name of Darren O'Shaughnessy) about the struggle of a boy who has become involved in the world of vampires. 

A film based on the first three books in the series was released in theatres on October 23, 2009. A manga series was published by Takahiro Arai.



h4. See

* http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Saga_of_Darren_Shan

title: crotch_cannon
body: A projectile or directed-energy weapon located on or in the crotch of a person or mecha. Usually of such shape as to be a [[phallic_symbol|phallic symbol]] (e.g., a gun barrel, etc.), sometimes including formations suggestive of [[testicles]].

title: transformers:_rescue_bots
body:
A 2012 [[Transformers]] series targeted at a much younger demographic than the series' usual. It is a spin-off of [i][[Transformers Prime]][/i], and is the longest running series in the franchise with a total of 104 episodes. Unlike most Transformers series, it does not feature [[Decepticon|Decepticons]] or any other antagonist faction, instead focusing on the cast's work saving humans from natural disasters and accidents.

It was followed up in 2018 by [i][[Transformers: Rescue Bots Academy|Rescue Bots Academy]][/i].

title: transformers_cloud

title: bodyboard
body: A bodyboard or boogie board is a hydrodynamic foam board used for surfing.  They're shorter than [[surfboard|surfboards]] and are most commonly used with the rider on their knees or stomach as opposed to standing on it.

title: surfboard_leash
body:
A surfboard leash is a cord that fastens to the tail of the [[surfboard]] and connects to a cuff worn on the ankle of the surfer.  This is to prevent the surfboard from being swept away by waves and stops runaway surfboards from hitting other surfers and swimmers.

This tag may also be used for bodyboard leashes.  These leashes are similar to surfboard leashes, but are fasten to the front end of the [[bodyboard]] and connect to a cuff worn on the wrist or bicep of the bodyboarder.

title: ramenman
body: Blood-thirsty martial arts Chojin. After his loss to Kinnikuman, he softened up and became a wise teacher to [[Brocken_Jr.]] [[Warsman]] put him into a coma, but he came back as Mongolman until his loss with Buffaloman to the Hell's Missionaries during the Dream Tag Tournament. Ramenman returned during the Survivor Match tournament and helped out Kinnikuman again.

title: terryman
body: Terryman is [[kinnikuman_(character)|Kinnikuman]]'s tag-team partner. At first, he epitomized the negative stereotypes of Americans, but Kinnikuman slapped some sense into him. They became friends after that. Known for having an artificial leg after Kinkotsuman gravely injured him.

title: kuroko_kamenaga
body: Kuroko Kamenaga is one of the female students and a member of the Student Council who currently attends Akademi High School.

title: robin_mask
body: At first, Robin Mask is a recurring antagonist of [[Kinnikuman]], even training [[Warsman]] to defeat [[Kinnikuman_(character)|Kinnikuman]]. After the 21st Chojin Olympics, Warsman and Robin Mask properly join the Justice Chojin. Robin Mask is seen as a mentor character for the Justice Chojin, having plenty of keen insight to defeat his opponents.

title: warsman
body: The son of Mikhailman and Natasha Volkova. Both of his parents died during his youth. Experienced discrimination for being a robot from humans. Was nearly used by the USSR as a soldier until he broke free. His trainer is [[robin_mask|Robin Mask]], who used him as a way to defeat [[kinnikuman_(character)|Kinnikuman]]. Joined the Justice Chojin after the 21st Chojin Olympics with Robin Mask.

title: shanxi_type_17
body: A Chinese copy of the Mauser C96 pistol manufactured by the arsenal of Shanxi warlord Yen Hsi-shan from 1929 to 1931.  It was unique in that it was chambered for the .45 ACP cartridge, rather than the 7.63mm Mauser or 9mm Parabellum chamberings typical of C96es and their many Chinese and Spanish clones.

title: shadowgate
body:
A [[fantasy]] point-and-click adventure game developed by "ICOM Simulations.":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ICOM_Simulations It is notorious for many opportunities of death. "Kemco Corporation":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kemco ported this game to the [[NES]]. A remake was released for Steam in 2014.

The Japanese version is characterized by the subject of the game messages. For example;
[quote]
English ver: "IT’S A SAD THING THAT [b][i]YOUR[/i][/b] ADVENTURES HAVE ENDED HERE!!"
Japanese ver: 「ざんねん！！　わたしのぼうけんは　ここで　おわってしまった！」 (lit. "SHAME! MY ADVENTURE HAS TO END HERE!" alt. "IT’S A SAD THING THAT [b][i]MY[/i][/b] ADVENTURES HAVE ENDED HERE!!")
[/quote]

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shadowgate 
* [[Death (entity)]]

title: minicon
body: Introduced in [i][[Transformers Armada]][/i], Minicons are small Transformers that are about as tall as a human teenager and turn into minature versions of vehicles. They are present on both the [[Autobot]] and [[Decepticon]] factions and can interlock with regular Transformers to give them special attacks and power boosts.

title: transformers_cyberverse
body:
A 2018 [[Transformers]] series. Unlike previous TV series, Cyberverse featured half-length episodes and utilizes many of the characters' evergreen designs as opposed to new unique designs. The series features appearances from new versions of characters from assorted other entries in the franchise.

The series ran for 3 seasons, and was rebranded as [i]Transformers: Bumblebee Cyberverse Adventures[/i] in the third season.

title: transformers:_war_for_cybertron
body:
A 2010 [[Transformers]] video game developed by High Moon Studios for [[Xbox 360]], [[PlayStation 3]], and [[computer|PC]]. The game is a third person shooter that depicts the war on Cybertron, and is technically part of the same continuity as [i][[Transformers Prime]][/i], despite having a vastly different art style. It features campaigns for both the [[Autobot|Autobots]] and [[Decepticon|Decepticons]], as well as online multiplayer, however the multiplayer servers have been shut down. 

It spawned several tie-in novels, a comic, and was followed by a sequel, [i][[Transformers: Fall of Cybertron|Fall of Cybertron]][/i].

Not to be confused with the [[transformers: war for cybertron trilogy|Netflix series/toyline]] of the same name.

title: straizo
body:

title: duke
body:
An older artist, now seemingly retired.  Focused on [[public nudity]], specifically his [[Zenkai Gakuen]] series - a take on the "Emperor's New Clothes" only more like "The Emperor's New School Uniforms".  Also focuses on a series called "The Planetary Hopping Girl", a sci-fi series about a girl who ends up trapped on a feral world without clothing.  In addition, does a small "choose your own adventure" style series based on his BBSes and feedback he gets from previous pictures.

Some [[loli]] and [[guro]] content.

Sadly, he appears to have gone DFE, removing his Pixiv and other sites.  No archive of his artwork appears to exist.  Remember to archive everything, people!

title: kanzaki_sayaka_(hg_ni_koisuru_futari)
body:
The main character of [[HG ni Koisuru Futari]]. She is a 30 year old office worker who secretly loves [[Gundam]] and building [[gunpla]]. She has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] and [[red eyes]], and is often seen wearing a [[business suit]]. She is particularly fond of [[Gundam SEED]], as the [[Strike Gundam]] is her favorite mobile suit, and she feels an affinity towards [[Shinn Asuka]].

She works at the same company as [[Kannawa Azusa]] from [[Bukiyou na Senpai]], and is her senior.

title: ibis_douglas
body:
Ibis Douglas is a [[Super Robot Wars]] character. She pilots the Astelion, Astelion AS, Altairion, and Hyperion, and her nickname is "Shooting Star". [[Tsugumi Takakura]] is her navigator.

She is well-known for overcoming personal difficulty, the rapid-fire aerial barrages her mecha usually specialize in, her clumsiness (Shooting Star was once a teasing nickname for her), incredible degree of moe (she won the 2006 SaiMoe RPG contest), her red hair with dark streaks... and her below average-sized breasts, which do not bounce in animations - the last is usually pointed out in fanart (mainly due to most other girls being above average in size)

Referred to on image boards (/m/ most of the time) as "love", alongside the mobile suit [[Acguy]] and [[Nono (Top wo Nerae 2!)|Nono]] of [[Top wo Nerae 2!]] - probably because of being huggable and dangerous in equal amounts.

title: ign_x_va-11_hall-a_contest
body:
The [i]IGN x VA-11 HALL-A[/i] fanart contest ran from October 21 to November 3, 2017.

The contest was held in anticipation of the Japanese PS Vita release of [i][[VA-11 HALL-A]][/i].
Contestants entered by tweeting their illustration with the hashtag "#IGNxVA11HallAイラコン":[https://twitter.com/hashtag/IGNxVA11HallA%E3%82%A4%E3%83%A9%E3%82%B3%E3%83%B3?src=hash].

h4. Prizes [2]

[quote]
* 最優秀賞（1名）：PS Vitaパッケージ版「VA-11 Hall-A」初回特典付（サウンドトラックCDとコースター）
* 敢闘賞（10名）：「VA-11 Hall-A」Steam キー（発売に合わせて日本語がアップデート予定。既にお買上げの方は布教用に使おう！）
* 参加賞（抽選で20名）：「VA-11 Hall-A」ノベルティ用ポストカード
[/quote]


h4. Results [2]

Below are the contest results. 
The creators of [i]VA-11 HALL-A[/i], [[kiririn51|Christopher Ortiz]] (design and illustration) and Fernando Damas (writing and programming), wrote comments about each of the winning entries. In some cases, these comments have been included in the Commentary of the below linked posts.

* Grand prize
** [[bamboo_(merenge_doll)|merenge doll]] - post #3034507

* Fighting Spirit Prize (Runner up)
** 

* Fighting Spirit Prize (9 awarded) 敢闘賞9名 - 敢闘賞（10名）：「VA-11 Hall-A」Steam キー（発売に合わせて日本語がアップデート予定。既にお買上げの方は布教用に使おう！）
** [[Tsujita Daisuke]]  - post #3034483, post #3034489


h4. Links

* "Contest announcement and rules":[http://jp.ign.com/vallhalla/18564/news/va-11-hall-a]
* [2] "Contest results":[http://jp.ign.com/vallhalla/19287/news/va-11-hall-a]

title: cuey_c_lops
body:
An [[original]] character from [[rakurakutei ramen]], she first appeared in [i]Ghostrick Live[/i] before reappearing in the 4-koma proper in a different form. Either way, she has [[silver hair]] and a light [[aqua_eyes|aqua eye]].

She is a cyclops and one of many maids in the Schtlehertz estate. Normally, she would be gigantic (12 meters tall when last measured) but she could shrink herself to a shorter but still unwieldy 3 meters in [i]Ghostrick Live[/i].

By the time she reappeared in the 4-koma, she learned to shrink even further to the size of a young child and changed her face to appear human, although she is still unskilled, as she can't give herself two eyes and has to hide the "lack" of her left eye with an eyepatch. Ironically, she appeared closer to her actual age (in human terms) in [i]Ghostrick Live[/i] as she revealed that she is actually 18 years old (in early 2019), about the same physical or chronological age as the school cast (that would make her about 15 during [i]Ghostrick Live[/i]). She presented herself as the Twins' personal maid as to ensure future appearences.

title: teiuka_mou_neyou
body:
A line said by [[Hoshimiya Ichigo]] in the first episode of [[aikatsu!|Aikatsu!]] to [[Hoshimiya Raichi]]. Raichi expresses his excitement over [[Kanzaki Mizuki]]'s performance and is unable to sleep, but Ichigo is (at the time) uninterested and doesn't share her enthusiasm. 

The line became a [[meme|running gag]] among Aikatsu! fans due to its versatile nature and humorous delivery.

Translates to something like "Actually, let's just go to sleep already."

title: god_eater
body:
A 2010 [[Bandai Namco]] game for the [[PlayStation Portable]], with a 2011 expanded version called "Gods Eater Burst" [sic] which was also the only version released outside of Japan.

By the year 2071, humanity was pushed to near-extinction by the [[Aragami]], omnivorous monsters mistaken for deities. In a struggle for survival, a group of humans, dubbed "God Eaters", were tasked with hunting them down using God Arcs, biomechanical weapons made from Oracle Cells (the same material which forms the Aragami) and controlled via Oracle Cells injected into their own bodies.

GOD EATER Character Design: 板倉耕一 (Itakura Kouichi) (General NPC characters like Amamiya Lindow etc., main graffics), 曽我部修司 (Sogabe Shuuji) (Protagonist and Fenrir school uniform design, public relations illustrations)

GOD EATER BURST Character Design: 小林くるみ (Kobayashi Kurumi) (Ren's design, sub character redesign of defense group etc., new player clothes design, first time priviledge premium clothes design, other illustrations)

h4. Games
* God Eater (2010) - PSP
* [[God Eater Burst]] (2011) - PSP
* God Eater 2 (2013) - PSP, PS Vita
* [[God Eater 2: Rage Burst]] (2015) - PS4, PS Vita, Windows
* [[God Eater Resurrection]] (2015) - PS4, PS Vita, Windows
* God Eater Online (2016) - iOS, Android
* [[God Eater Resonant Ops]] (2018) - iOS, Android
* [[God Eater 3]] (2018) - PS4, Nintendo Switch, Windows

h4. External links

* GOD EATER Official Site: http://www.godeater.jp/
* GOD EATER Project G.E. Koushiki Blog: http://ameblo.jp/project-ge/
* Wikipedia: http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/ゴッドイーター

title: jigoku_sensei_nube
body:
A supernatural comedy series that was serialized in Shounen Jump from 1993 until 1999. A 48-episode anime was also produced in 1996.

[[Nueno Meisuke]], aka Nube, is the homeroom teacher for Class 5-3 at Doumori Elementary. He is also a skilled exorcist, protecting his students and Doumori's townsfolk from supernatural threats with strength borrowed from a powerful demon sealed in his left hand - a technique he calls the Demon's Hand.

title: sword_hilt
body:
Use for when it is clear that their is only a sword hilt, with no blade either present or manifested.

* If only the end of the hilt is visible, or the sword is in the scabbard, then assume that it is a full [[sword]].
* [[Broken sword]]s do not count either, such as [[Meliodas]]'s sword from [[Nanatsu no Taizai]].
* [b]Do not tag [[sword]] when only the hilt is present![/b]
* Do not tag [[holding sword]] either as that implicates [b]sword[/b].

title: onean_(pandea_work)
body:
An original character by [[pandea work]]. Has [[blue eyes]], [[silver hair]], and [[medium breasts]]. Often shown with a [[hair ornament]], such as a [[hair ribbon]], or [[hairclip]] [[horns]]; as well as wearing [[revealing clothes]] involving a [[pelvic curtain]].

Best known for a "mod":[https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/72385] for [[The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim]] by the artist wherein she's a healer for hire with custom dialogue, and offers unique services such as skill training, a healing aura, and giving the player potions implied to made from her [[pussy juice|bodily fluids]].

title: water_bike
body: A variety of small one-man [[watercraft]] that utilize a bicycle-like pedaling system for propulsion.  Traditional water bikes are setup with a bicycle-like frame that is supported by pontoons on either side.  Peddling powers a propeller that moves it forward and the handle bars control a rudder for steering.  Some water bikes utilize hydrofoils instead of pontoons, though these also feature an electronic assist to maintain speeds necessary for the hydrofoil to stay up.

title: hermes_(kino_no_tabi)
body:
Character from [[Kino no Tabi]].

Hermes is a talking motorrad who travels with [[Kino (kino no tabi)|]] to various countries and lands. He is often pessimistically realist, unbiased, and usually comes across as the comic relief character. He has a tendency to complain, which sometimes annoys Kino. Despite this, he is a very reliable companion both mentally and physically, as he is the only person who Kino can speak with about her innermost thoughts.

Hermes is a [[Brough Superior]] SS100 [[motorcycle]]. 

In [[Gakuen Kino]],  Hermes is a cell phone strap. He is described as two canvas strips connected by a brass buckle with a Brough Superior SS100 engraved into the buckle. His personality does not change.

h4. External links

* "Kino's Journey Wiki: Hermes":http://kinosjourney.wikia.com/wiki/Hermes
* "Wikipedia: Brough Superior":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brough_Superior

title: shizu_(kino_no_tabi)
body:
A character from [[Kino no Tabi]], he travels with his companions [[riku_(kino_no_tabi)|Riku]] and [[tea_(kino_no_tabi)|Tea]].

Shizu is a beige skinned young man with [[black hair]] and [[black eyes]], he is dressed in a [[green_sweater|green]] [[sweater]] and [[black pants]], wielding a [[katana]].

title: riku_(kino_no_tabi)
body: Character in [[Kino no Tabi]]. Riku is a talking dog of the Samoyed breed who accompanies [[Shizu (kino no tabi)|]] on his journeys.

title: tea_(kino_no_tabi)
body:
A character from [[Kino no Tabi]], she travels with her companions [[Riku_(kino_no_tabi)|]] and [[Shizu (kino no tabi)|]].

Tea is a young girl with a [[short_hair|short]] [[white hair]] and [[green eyes]], she dresses in [[grey shorts]] and a [[long_sleeves|long]] [[brown shirt]]; she oftentimes wears a large messenger [[bag]] on her back, as well as [[elbow_pads|elbow]] and [[knee pads]].

title: kino_no_tabi
body:
[b]Kino no Tabi[/b] (キノの旅, lit. [i]Kino's Journey[/i]) is a Japanese light novel series written by Keiichi Sigsawa and illustrated by [[Kuroboshi Kouhaku]], first published in 2000. An anime adaptation produced by [i]Genco[/i] has aired in April 2003 and a second anime adaptation produced by [i]Egg Firm[/i] has aired in October 2017.

h4. Characters
* [[Kino (kino no tabi)|]]

title: hero_(dq8)
body:
The protagonist of [i][[Dragon Quest VIII]][/i]. Ostensibly a random guardsman of Castle Trodain, he was thrusted in his quest by a great curse upon the castle by [[Dhoulmagus]]. For some reason, he was the only one to be completely unaffected by the curse...

For the sake of convenience, his default name is [b]"Eight"[/b]. In the English version, he is often refered to as [b]"Guv"[/b], usually by [[Yangus]].
